datastats module¶

Define DataStats class for managing statistical data.

class datastats.CachedAttribute(method, name=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Computes attribute value and caches it in instance. Not actually used in code at present, but could be useful for later refactoring. Author: Denis Otkidach

Example of use:
class MyClass(object):
def myMethod(self):
# ...

myMethod = CachedAttribute(myMethod)

Use “del inst.myMethod” to clear cache.

class datastats.DataStats(var_names=None, raw_data=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Manages statistical information on causal model.

Allows for specification of statistics “by hand” when sample data is not available.

get_corr_mat()[source]¶

Get correlation matrix, either by returning cached value or calculating from raw data.

Returns:correlation matrix
get_nsamp()[source]¶

Get the number of samples for computation of Fisher’s z.

The number of samples is computed from the sample data, if available.

Returns:number of samples
get_part_corr(pair, cond_set)[source]¶

Get partial correlation and corresponding Fisher’s z for a pair of variables, conditioned on a set of other variables.

Parameters:
  • pair – variables to correlate
  • cond_set – conditioning variables
Returns:

part_corr = partial correlation, fisher_z = Fisher’s z statistic
get_prec_mat(var_set_key)[source]¶

Get precision matrix for a desired conditioning set.

The precision matrix is an intermediate variable for calculating partial correlation.

Parameters:var_set_key – set of conditioning variables
Returns:precision matrix for conditioning variables specified in var_set_key
set_corr_mat(corr_mat)[source]¶

Set correlation matrix by hand. Use when raw data is not present.

Parameters:corr_mat – correlation matrix
set_nsamp(nsamp)[source]¶

Set the number of samples.

Use only in the absence of actual sample data.

Parameters:nsamp – number of samples
